com.googlecode.javacpp

Class Loader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.javacpp.Loader

  • public class Loader
extends Object
    The Loader contains functionality to load native libraries, but also has a bit of everything that does not fit anywhere else. In addition to its loading features, it also has utility methods to get the platform name and its properties from Java resources, to append to them properties from Class annotations, to extract file resources to the temporary directory, and to get the offsetof() or sizeof() a native struct, class, or union with its Pointer peer class and a HashMap initialized by the native libraries.
    Author:
    Samuel Audet

      • loadLibraries

        static boolean loadLibraries
        Flag set by the Builder to tell us not to try to load anything.

      • loadedLibraries

        static Map<String,String> loadedLibraries
        Contains all the native libraries that we have loaded to avoid reloading them.

      • memberOffsets

        static WeakHashMap<Class<? extends Pointer>,HashMap<String,Integer>> memberOffsets
        Contains offsetof() and sizeof() values of native types of struct, class, and union. A WeakHashMap is used to prevent the Loader from hanging onto Class objects the user may be trying to unload.

        Returns:
        the Properties from resources

      • appendProperties

        public static Class appendProperties(Properties properties,
                     Class cls)
        Appends to properties the ones from Class annotations. If no properties are found on the class, makes a search for the first enclosing class with properties that we can use, appends those properties, and returns the enclosing Class used.
        Parameters:
        properties - the Properties to update
        cls - the Class from which to take new Properties
        Returns:
        the actual enclosing Class on which we found the Properties

      • appendProperty

        public static void appendProperty(Properties properties,
                  String name,
                  String separator,
                  String... values)
        Appends new property values to a given key name of the properties.
        Parameters:
        properties - the Properties to update
        name - the key name of the property to update
        separator - the separator character to use for splitting and merging values
        values - the property values to append, either an array or merged with separators

      • getCallerClass

        public static Class getCallerClass(int i)
        Returns the Class object that contains a caller's method.
        Parameters:
        i - the offset on the call stack of the method of interest
        Returns:
        the Class found from the calling context, or null if not found

      • extractResource

        public static File extractResource(String name,
                   File directory,
                   String prefix,
                   String suffix)
                            throws IOException
        Extracts by name a resource using the ClassLoader of the caller.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource passed to Class.getResource(String)
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:

      • extractResource

        public static File extractResource(Class cls,
                   String name,
                   File directory,
                   String prefix,
                   String suffix)
                            throws IOException
        Extracts by name a resource using the ClassLoader of the specified Class.
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class from which to load resources
        name - the name of the resource passed to Class.getResource(String)
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        extractResource(URL, File, String, String)

      • extractResource

        public static File extractResource(URL resourceURL,
                   File directory,
                   String prefix,
                   String suffix)
                            throws IOException
        Extracts a resource into the specified directory and with the specified prefix and suffix for the filename. If both prefix and suffix are null, the original filename is used, so the directory must not be null.
        Parameters:
        resourceURL - the URL of the resource to extract
        directory - the output directory (null == System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir"))
        prefix - the prefix of the temporary filename to use
        suffix - the suffix of the temporary filename to use
        Returns:
        the File object representing the extracted file
        Throws:
        IOException - if fails to extract resource properly

      • getTempDir

        public static File getTempDir()
        Creates a unique name for tempDir out of System.getProperty("java.io.tmpdir") and System.nanoTime().
        Returns:
        tempDir

      • isLoadLibraries

        public static boolean isLoadLibraries()
        Returns:
        loadLibraries

      • load

        public static String load()
        Loads native libraries associated with the Class of the caller.
        See Also:
        load(Class)

      • load

        public static String load(Class cls)
        Loads native libraries associated with the given Class.
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class to get native library information from
        Returns:
        the full path of the file, or the library name, loaded (but if (!loadLibraries || cls == null) { return null; })
        Throws:
        NoClassDefFoundError - on Class initialization failure
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - on native library loading failure

      • loadLibrary

        public static String loadLibrary(String libnameversion)
        Tries to load library from the caller's Class resources or System.loadLibrary(String).
        See Also:
        loadLibrary(Class, String[], String)

      • loadLibrary

        public static String loadLibrary(String[] paths,
                 String libnameversion)
        Tries to load library from the caller's Class resources, the paths, or System.loadLibrary(String).
        See Also:
        loadLibrary(Class, String[], String)

      • loadLibrary

        public static String loadLibrary(Class cls,
                 String[] paths,
                 String libnameversion)
        First tries to extract and load the library from the Class resources, but if fails, continues to try loading from the paths (if not null), and finally System.loadLibrary(String).
        Parameters:
        cls - the Class whose package name and ClassLoader are used to extract from resources
        paths - the directories to scan for if we fail to extract the library from resources
        libnameversion - the name of the library + "@" + optional version tag
        Returns:
        the full path of the file, or the library name, loaded (but if (!loadLibraries || cls == null) { return null; })
        Throws:
        UnsatisfiedLinkError - on failure

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)

      • putMemberOffset

        static void putMemberOffset(String typeName,
                   String member,
                   int offset)
                     throws ClassNotFoundException
        Called by native libraries to put offsetof() and sizeof() values in memberOffsets. Tries to load the Class object for typeName using the ClassLoader of the Loader.
        Parameters:
        typeName - the name of the peer Class acting as interface to the native type
        member - the name of the native member variable
        offset - the value of offsetof() (or sizeof() when member.equals("sizeof"))
        Throws:
        ClassNotFoundException - on Class initialization failure

      • putMemberOffset

        static void putMemberOffset(Class<? extends Pointer> type,
                   String member,
                   int offset)
        Called by native libraries to put offsetof() and sizeof() values in memberOffsets.
        Parameters:
        type - the peer Class acting as interface to the native type
        member - the name of the native member variable
        offset - the value of offsetof() (or sizeof() when member.equals("sizeof"))

      • offsetof

        public static int offsetof(Class<? extends Pointer> type,
           String member)
        Gets offsetof() values from memberOffsets filled by native libraries.
        Parameters:
        type - the peer Class acting as interface to the native type
        member - the name of the native member variable
        Returns:
        memberOffsets.get(type).get(member)

      • sizeof

        public static int sizeof(Class<? extends Pointer> type)
        Gets sizeof() values from memberOffsets filled by native libraries.
        Parameters:
        type - the peer Class acting as interface to the native type
        Returns:
        memberOffsets.get(type).get("sizeof")
